replies.commentBody:
Well, your questions are exactly the ones an independent investigation might answer.

One question in return: Why isn't Trump releasing his tax returns if everything is so above-board?

comments.commentBody:
This article is another breathless example of innuendo and malice on behalf of the NYTimes against our current President. The article refers over and over to "the intelligence", which is what? Oh, you can't say. Oh, John Podesta's emails were published and this somehow is treason and impeachable? Oh, Trump's people talked to Russians but we don't have any way of knowing what was said? Tell us, NYTimes, what laws were broken? How were members of he Trump campaign cunduct illegal operations? How is this linked to Trump?

What would be more interesting is what are the NYTimes links to Carlos Slim who has lost sixteen billion dollars since Trump was elected and is he using his ownership at the Times to discredit Trump in an attempt to regain his fortune? Is this a scenario that may be impacting the Times editorial content?

If nothing else, please know that it is garbage, fake news, articles like this one for which I recently canceled my subscription to your fake organization.

replies.commentBody: Of course you don't fear Russian Communists!  The Soviet Union vanished decades ago.  Russia is now a right-wing authoritarian kleptocracy -- just like Trump hopes to create here.

comments.commentBody:
As a military veteran, I can tell you, I fear American Democrats much
more than Russian Communists. Hillary compromises national security
with thousands of her e-mails and nothing was done. Now this intense
scrutiny on Trump. The left is out to get him, one way or the other.
What will happen if/when Trump's tax returns are leaked showing close ties to the Russians?

replies.commentBody: Do you realize that "Wall Street Stooges" now populate the Trump cabinet and group of advisors? Wilbur Ross, Steve Mnuchin, Anthony Scaramucci, etc.,  Many more than ever populated an Obama - and probably more than a Clinton - cabinet. Clinton lost THE ELECTORAL COLLEGE AND HENCE, ELECTION because she was a bad candidate. SHE WON THE POPULAR VOTE BY A SIGNIFICANT 2.9 MILLION VOTES.
Unlike Trump and his Goldman-Sachs cabinet, right?   Best laugh I've had today.

comments.commentBody: The Democrats won't win back power trying to connect Russians to why Hillary Clinton lost.  She lost because she is a Wall Street Stooge.

Why wasn't this information released before the election, especially after Comey pulled his little stunt? This is another case where Obama's high-minded decency proved to be a liability for the Democrats and the country. Republicans would not have hesitated. If a Democratic presidential campaign had been in secret contact with Russian intelligence prior to the election, republican calls for impeachment would be deafening.

What a ridiculous article - full of speculation and bogus innuendo.  And worse, if it's true that the U.S. monitored some phone conversations in Russia - the NYT just blew a source and method.  The darkest part of this article is the emergence of an Obama appointee shadow regime within the IC.

OK, now I get it. The reason why Obama's (shaken by what he knew) chose the theme of 'The Fragility of the Democratic State' (my quote) is more evident to me now than ever. As reported in this article, the purview was at some point closed to a select few. Obama obviously had it and he knew it could not be withheld from 45.

Something is coming down, folks. It will take a while before they cross their 't' s , but we apparently have a dossier of our own. The push was only made more urgent by the incredible personal putdowns of two of the shrewdest men to ever head a government agency, Mr. Brennan and Mr. Clapper.

replies.commentBody: Just search online for the story connecting Putin, Trump, Rosneft, Exxon, Ukraine, sanctions, and oil money. It's all out there in the open. The 3-ring circus in DC is distracting us from the actual truth.

Then why did Sessions DENY talking to Russians under oath in his confirmation hearing -- twice? His answers were at best misleading, and at worst lies.

And it's well known that Putin hated the Clintons, whom he could not manipulate and who had no illusions about his character.

comments.commentBody:
The whole idea that Trumps team coordinated with the Russians is so far fetched. So what if Sessions met with a Russian ambassador. Does anybody release believe they talked about hacking the election?
The biggest problem I find with a Russian Trump connection is why would the Russians do anything for Trump.? Nobody gave Trump a chance at winning the presidency until he won. That includes the Russians. Why would the Russians do anything for nothing? Or is it that Putin is a big fan of the Appretice? Like as Putin watched the show it dawned on him that he could make Trump the next US president. He then invited Trump to Moscow and had prostitutes urinate on him. It is so impossible to believe.

Though a Canadian, I did volunteer in 2 US Campaigns - McGovern 1972 and Obama 2008.

Obama win may have been the sweet revenge for McGovern defeat, but Mr. Obama has been the greatest disappointment of my life. A smooth salesman who produced little permanent legislation of value. His smooth talk of 8 years gave rise to Daesh/ISIL, needless fight with Russia, shamelessly bowing down to Petro-sheikhs and kowtowing to China. His biggest achievement may be the ushering in of Mr. Trump.

No fan of Trump let us give him marks for being the child who shouts that Emperor has no clothes. Trump may not have answers, he certainly raises the right questions - de-industrialization of America, weakening of military, Islamic terrorism menace, and illegal aliens. Hopefully a wiser person will emerge to lead the nation and solve the problems that Trump rightly raises.

For us foreign Democrat lovers they blew up themselves by snatching from Sanders a well-deserved nomination. Said Churchill - Americans end up doing the right thing after trying all wrong ones. Hope he is right one more time.
The Russians are Coming! The Russians are Coming!  Alan Arkin is one of my favorite actors......
This feels like the U.S. is failing each other and wont come back together.My worst nightmare.

It's time for the Democrats to start asking, why the Republican party is so involved with Russia? Why do Republicans seem eager to weaken the U.S. influence around the world while allowing Russia to continue to threaten it's neighbors? Why are the Republicans so willing to avoid any criticism of Putin? The party that wears their patriotism on their sleeve, seems to lack it in their hearts.

The hypocrisy is astounding, if Clinton or Obama was involved this deep, the Republicans would be having hearings, the right wing media propaganda would be apoplectic, and Republicans would be parading in the streets with their guns. But when they collude with Russia... crickets.

I am a debt-laden college grad special unicorn millennial and I am so glad I finally subscribed to the NYT so I can support journalism like this. Please don't stop. Freedom of the Press is one of the most crucial sacred weapons we need more than ever to protect the pillars of our democracy. and why it will survive.
We are all in this together. I'll keep doing my part. See you all at the next town hall and the next March. #Resist

And lastly, MAHALO to Obama and the Obama Administration and our beloved Allies!

Lots of comments from Trump supporters saying this is nothing more than sour grapes and that they want names not anonymous sources.

Well, when the names start to appear and the time lines are drawn, will your comments change??
Sessions is contaminated, and needs to be removed.

So what do we the people of the United States need to do to get a new election?  Isn't this what people do when there is significant interference with the process?  You don't just pretend that nothing happened and the election still stands?  You revote, given the new facts.  I would love to see an uprising from the American people calling for a revote.  A short campaign period followed by a vote.  Britain voted for a new leader within a month.  We can, too.  There is no reason for campaigns to last two years anyway.

I can see how this plays out.  The Republicans will deny all accusations, discredit all sources, obfuscate all proceedings, rally their screaming base, and make false claims and in the end will emerge victorious because the Democrats have NO backbone and will once again cower to the intimidation of the Republicans.  Mark my words.

replies.commentBody: There may be no chance of impeachment but there is a chance of getting rid of the cabinet-full of deplorables and having some semblance of good governance.

comments.commentBody:
I think the NY Times, too many of its reporters and too many of its reporters have become so unhinged by the election of Donald Trump that they are simply grasping at every straw that floats by.

The chance of impeachment are zero to none while at the same time if the Democrats and their supporters keep to their current course of a radical turn to the left their chances of winning future elections will also be heading to zero and none.

If you look closely at Sessions' face while Senator Al Franken was asking him that question , he looks like he's going to die . Some of the newsreels shows Sessions' face while Franken is talking to him . It looked like he had a guilty conscience and was rapidly trying to figure out what he was going to say , to the point that he completely ignored the question and went on to defend himself , which the Senator never asked about . His face went from dread to that fake smiley face .

Are all of these threads just coincidences ? Come' on man !

How nefarious this whole thing is yet to be determined but clearly something is not on the up and up .

And now the Russian Ambassador is dead from a heart attack . So many Russians that become too public suddenly end up dead . Coincidence again ?

I believe it is the CIA whose saying is
" there are no coincidences " .

My deep deep concern is that it is our President who is under investigation . I pray that Comey and others in the CIA do not sweep this under the rug .
Thanks for doing that, guys.  Stopping the new powers from hiding the facts that could affect a huge part of the world.

A fish rots from the head first-- in this case an orange roughy.  The fake president should resign now in order to save us all (and himself) a protracted Watergate-style investigation.  Those honest men and women in the government who continue  to "leak" the truth to protect our Constitution rather than the usurper-in-chief should be given medals of freedom.

replies.commentBody:
So how do you explain Sessions's answer to Al Franken's question during the confirmation hearing?

Why didn't he just say, "I had two brief conversations with the Ambassador. We talked about ______. But to answer your question, Senator, yes, I would fully support an investigation into ties between Russia and Trump campaign staff."

That would be the answer of someone with nothing to hide.

comments.commentBody: Yet another political Rorschach test where Trump's opponents see a nefarious, demonic subterfuge while everyone else see's these conversations between Mr. Sessions and the Russian ambassador as a subset of more than 25 conversations he had with ambassadors from other countries as part of his job. Just saying the word 'Russia' has become bait on the hook for Dems over the past year, they can't resist.

but no investigation into DNC election tampering...

Funny that.

"A White House official, speaking on the condition of anonymity, backed up Mr. Sessions late Wednesday, calling the accusations “the latest attack against the Trump administration by partisan Democrats.”"

Odd response from a President who just days ago railed against anonymous sources.

The 0 Admin preserved data, and conspicuously absent is any reporting on the illegality of the leaks  by which the NYT is getting the info.  At least the NYT  is consistent with Ex Pres 0's admin, the ends always justifies the means.
